summary: Patricia M Orr was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). She is listed in several payroll and certification reports spanning from 1977 to 1978. These documents detail her inclusion in the committee's staff, indicating her role within the organization during its investigation into the JFK assassination. The documents provide her name, and in some cases, her position and salary, as part of the committee's personnel records.
significance: Patricia M Orr's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, contributing to the administrative and operational functions of the committee during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the documents do not specify her exact role, her presence on payroll and certification reports indicates her involvement in the committee's activities.
